label: Folder 45: George Simons Letter 2
description: Letter to Robert N.S. Whitelaw from George W. Simons regarding traffic surveys in Charleston given by the Charleston Boy Scouts (June 6, 1944).

metadata.label: Transcript
metadata.value: June 6, 1944.  Mr. Roberts. S. Whitelaw, Director,  Carolina Art Associaltion,  G-ibbes Art Gallery,  Charleston, 5, South Carolina.  Dear Mr. Whitelaw:  I have your letter of the second and the taey sheets sent under  separate cover.  From a casua inspection it would appear that the boys did a pretty  good job. A compiation of results has been started, which should be  ready for review very shorty.  The missing stations should be competed next, then we will select  about three stations for tweve hour counts.  At our next meeting we shall initiate some of our committee investigations into parking habits, storage spaces, etc.  Between now and then I will prepare a manua of instructions on procedure defining what to do  and how best to do it.  We  shall have further work, for some of the boys - not a of them,  after the tweve hour counts. It may be difficult to get many of the  boys this summer, especiay the best and oder ones but we shall make  up with the aduts on the committee.  The paper this morning announced the death of Mayor ockwood.  When would you ike to have the next meeting? Next week I shall be  tied up in the Tampa area but the following week [June 19-24] could come  to Charleston.  with best regards, I am  Sincerely yours,  George W. Simons Jr.
